TopicTitle: Anyone having issues in .90 with jet engines ignoring intake air?

Articles.Content:
Made a space plane with twin engines using the MK2 bicoupler (it splits of into 2 engine ports) in version .25 . Now in the KSP .90 when I load up the craft and trying flying only 1 of the engines will fire. Kerbal engineer and mechjeb shows the increase in dV and kN thrust when adding that second engine. But when out in the runway in flames out. I have million and billions of intake air all over the plane on both sides and it doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t make a difference.

Edited January 1, 2015 by lextacy
Release the brakes. The plane needs to move a little to get the intakes working.

You should post a screenshot of the plane. Have you tried creating a new plane from scratch in 0.90? It's possible that it's a backwards compatibility issue, although it should be fine. IntakeAir is behaving normally for me and seemingly most people.

Release the brakes. The plane needs to move a little to get the intakes working.

No it doesn't.
Based on your screenshot, the problem is that your plane does not exist.
made a brand new plane and the engines all work

made a brand new plane and the engines all work

Then yeah, probably a backwards compatibility issue

On the bright side, you get to use the new gizmos to make your plane even better than it was before!

Then yeah, probably a backwards compatibility issue

On the bright side, you get to use the new gizmos to make your plane even better than it was before!
